candidates.title: Publish 0.14.0-alpha.1
candidates.body: I believe that `multihash` and `multiaddr` didn't get any breaking change.

candidates.title: Pin protobuf versin and publish 0.13.2
candidates.body:
(note: this PR is towards master)

Fix #1363 
Also includes https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/1347

candidates.title: Several changes.
candidates.body:
- ~Pin `futures_codec` to version 0.3.3 as later versions require at least `bytes-0.5` which he have not upgraded to yet.~ Update to `bytes` v0.5 except for `multiaddr`.
- Replace `futures::executor::block_on` with `async_std::task::block_on` where `async-std` is already a dependency to work around an issue with `park`/`unpark` behaviour.
- Use the published versions of `quicksink`, `soketto` and `yamux`.
- Use `futures-timer` version 2 in `core` which removes the last (transitive) dependency to `futures-preview`.

Depends on https://github.com/paritytech/unsigned-varint/pull/23.

candidates.title: Cleanups in libp2p-core in stable-futures branch
candidates.body: Removes a few left-overs, and lots of `Unpin` trait bounds replaced with `pin-project`.

candidates.title: secio: Back to 4-byte BE length prefix.
candidates.body: The secio spec states that each frame must be prefixed with a 32-bit big endian length prefix so we can not use an unsigned varint here.

candidates.title: Refactor the crate to use stable futures
candidates.body:
> **Note**: This PR should be merged using the "Merge" action of GitHub, in order to not lose history.

Rewrites lots of parts of the library to use stable futures rather than futures 0.1.
This unlocks the possibility to use async/await, and opens the door for further API refactorings later on.

There is one test failure right now, the "network simultaneous dial" test, which seems to be caused by the `V1Lazy` upgrade system. This needs to be investigated.

When it comes to reviewing, I don't know what everyone's opinion is. While many individual changes to the `stable-futures` branch have already been reviewed, unfortunately most of the changes made early on (notably in `core` and `swarm` haven't). I think most of the reviewing should be straight-forward, as most of the code is a 1:1 port of the old code.

A few things have changed:

- `ProtocolsHandler::poll` doesn't return an `Error` anymore. Instead, `ProtocolsHandlerEvent` (the return value of `poll`) has a new `Close` variant, which corresponds to what an error represented before.
- We're using `async-std` for networking, rather than `tokio`. This is for two reasons: this unties us from tokio (async-std futures can be polled with anything, while tokio networking futures can only be polled with tokio), and `async-std` was ready before `tokio` was.
- All the traits that have a `poll` function (i.e. `NetworkBehaviour`, `ProtocolsHandler`, `NodeHandler`) now have a `&mut Context` parameter to reflect the changes in the `Future` trait.
- The `core::upgrade` module was refactored. It now contains a few async methods that allow reading or writing a length-delimited message from a socket.

This pull request adjusts the Kademlia tests to the *stable future* refactoring.

(+ 2 minor fixes in noise and mdns)

candidates.title: Update root crate to use futures-0.3.
candidates.body:
Mostly mechanical. Creating a `CommonTransport` yields an `io::Result<_>` now since creating the `DnsConfig` may fail with an `io::Error` when creating the `ThreadPool`.

The `BandwithLogging` `Transport` impl requires `Unpin` for everything. This could potentially be optimised at some point.

The `DnsConfig` `Transport` impl had to be changed slightly:

(a) PR [[1311]] requires some `Send` bounds.
(b) The async block had to be changed to work around lifetime inference issues which resulted in an "one type is more general than the other" error.

[1311]: https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/1311

candidates.title: Update mdns dependencies to use futures-0.3
Use soketto's `reader-writer-split` branch.
candidates.body: Updates to a soketto version that uses futures-0.3.x. Depends on https://github.com/paritytech/soketto/pull/8 and https://github.com/paritytech/quicksink/pull/1.

candidates.title: Update libp2p-uds to futures 0.3
candidates.body: Switched from `romio` (which is unmaintained and is still using futures-preview) to `async-std`.

candidates.title: yamux: Use futures-0.3.
candidates.body: Upstream has been updated so we can use futures-0.3 now.

candidates.title: protocols/plaintext: Move to stable futures and use unsigned varints
candidates.body:
The plaintext 2.0 specification requires to use unsigned varints for
frame length delimiting instead of fixed 4 byte integer frame length
delimiting. This commit aligns the implementation with the
specification.

Seems to forget to upgrade the `parking_lot` dep of the `mplex` to v0.9

candidates.title: [libp2p-core-derive] Update dependencies
candidates.body: Signed-off-by: koushiro <koushiro.cqx@gmail.com>

candidates.title: Update yamux to development version.
candidates.body: This PR uses the Yamux development version which is based on futures-preview 0.3.0-alpha.19. Since we use a boxed version of the incoming `futures::stream::Stream` of substreams, we offer two sets of upgrades, one which requires a `Send` bound on the underlying I/O resource, and one which does not. If memory serves me well, we have some upgrades such as secio whose output is `!Send`. If we do not plan to support `!Send`, we can of course remove half of this PR.

candidates.title: Cherry-pick commits from master to stable-futures
candidates.body:
The `stable-futures` branch is a bit of a mess right now.
This PR cherry-picks the commits of master on top of `stable-futures`.
The idea is that we will then squash the commits of `stable-futures` and rebase on top of `master`.

We need to review the diff between `stable-futures` and `master` before merging anyway.

candidates.title: Remove using void to bypass ICE
candidates.body:
It turns out that nightly Rust ICEs when using enum with zero variants.
See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/65462

We were hoping that this ICE would eventually be fixed, but it's about to hit stable and it still isn't fix.

The solution now is unfortunately to remove using empty enums from our API.

Should be merged before #1294

candidates.title: Publish 0.13.0
candidates.body:
Publish a new version.

The previous version was published in August, which is a long time ago :scream: 

We probably want to merge `stable-futures` to `master` in the near futures, and we obviously want to publish a new version with all the fixes/changes to be merged beforehand, so that the switch to new futures is as straight-forward as possible.

candidates.title: misc/mdns: Update to futures-preview
candidates.body: This pull request updates `misc/mdns` to use `futures-preview` `0.3.0-alpha.17`. It is ready for review but still has a couple of `TODO` comments that I would like to have your input on.
